ideal_referral: 1. Patients or Families in Need A) Patients with advanced liver diseases, such as cirrhosis, liver cancer, or acute liver failure, who have been advised or are considering a liver transplant. B) Individuals with HPB-related conditions, such as pancreatic or bile duct cancer, requiring surgical intervention. C) Children and adults who may be seeking guidance for liver-related disorders or second opinions. 2. Referring Physicians and Specialists Gastroenterologists, hepatologists, and oncologists managing patients with liver or HPB issues who could benefit from transplant or surgical solutions. General physicians and family doctors who are the first point of contact for patients experiencing liver-related symptoms. 3. Hospitals and Healthcare Networks Hospitals or diagnostic centers that do not currently have liver transplant facilities and need a trusted expert to manage referrals or collaborate on cases. New liver transplant centers in Gujarat or surrounding states requiring guidance or inspection for operational approval. 4. Insurance and Medical Financing Agencies Professionals or organizations that support patients in navigating the costs and logistics of liver transplantation. 5. NGOs or Health Organizations Non-profit organizations working in the field of organ donation, transplantation awareness, or patient advocacy, looking for trusted surgeons for collaboration.
